channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Science Says a Longer Commute to Work Is Almost Never Worth the Money
item.description: At a minimum, the opportunity will need to pay 40 percent more for the tradeoff to be worth it.

item.title: Wear my brand: Why branded merch is the next post-ironic trend
item.description: You’ve probably seen them: clutch purses designed to look like croissants, anime-inspired hot sauce gear , purposefully ketchup-stained shirts , and e...

item.title: North Korea stole a record amount of crypto—again: report estimates its hackers’ 2025 haul at $2 billion
item.description: The country has now pilfered about $7 billion in crypto all-time.

item.title: U.K. startup CellVoyant debuts AI platform that could radically reduce the cost of cell-based therapies such as CAR-T immunotherapy for cancer
item.description: CellVoyant says its FateView platform can reduce the cost of producing viable cells for therapy by up to 80%

item.title: The American voter is angry about one thing above all and Trump’s tariffs are in the crossfire, Goldman’s chief political economist says
item.description: Cost of living is the issue driving the midterms. Trump calls affordability a "hoax" when Democrats say it, but his tariff regime is showing cracks.

item.title: This 1 Tweak to Your Body Language Makes You Much More Persuasive, Says a Study of 2,000 TED Talks
item.description: How to instantly win people over with some Italian influence.

item.title: Indie bookstores are making a shocking, triumphant comeback
item.description: The small American bookstore is back. Over the last five years, the number of independent bookstores in the U.S. jumped by 70%. In 2025 alone, 422 new...

item.title: BJ’s Wholesale Club is opening 9 new stores in 2026. Here’s the full list of locations coming soon
item.description: BJ’s Wholesale Club is planning to open nine new U.S. stores in 2026, and already debuted a new location on December 17 in Casselberry, Florida—its th...

item.title: The future of work isn’t man versus machine. It’s man plus machine
item.description: There’s no shortage of apocalyptic headlines about the future of work in the era of artificial intelligence . For workers, the technology has inflicte...

item.title: Here’s Why Stocks Could Break Records in the Next 2 Weeks
item.description: Seasonality, Fed policy and market breadth point to higher asset prices.

item.title: Octopus could be the next commercially farmed seafood. Should it be?

item.title: Neuroscience Just Discovered a Weird Way to Tell When Someone Is Really Listening to You
item.description: Watching when people blink can help you tell whether you have their attention.

item.title: AI governance becomes a board mandate as operational reality lags
item.description: Fortune 500 companies are racing to formalize AI oversight.

item.title: Why AT&T’s RTO Drama Isn’t Really About Office Chairs, but the Future of Corporate Culture
item.description: The memo named a growing tension all organizations face—the unspoken contract between employer and employee is shifting.

item.title: Want a job in AI-era tech? Forget prestigious degrees—tech leaders want to see your GitHub projects and internships
item.description: As entry-level tech hiring slows, one CEO warns avoiding AI skills would be like “taking crazy pills”—and says Gen Z must show real proof of ability.
